intro: Ischnosiphon crassispicus, commonly known as the thick-hair spike, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Ischnosiphon crassispicus is often found in rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
